noun.description: A small handheld tool with a flat, pointed blade, used to apply and spread mortar or plaster.
A small handheld tool with a curved scoop for lifting plants or earth.

verb.description: Apply or spread with or as if with a trowel.
examples: trowel in enough soil to form a dome
Kerrie troweled jam onto her toast

origin: Middle English (as a noun): from Old French truele, from medieval Latin truella, alteration of Latin trulla scoop, diminutive of trua skimmer.
